reviews.text: Although the people there were nice, and the food was okay, There were too many of ants in the room. When the fan was turned on, it lifted up the lino on the floor and make quite a noise.
reviews.title: Worn out

reviews.text: There was no ensuite bathroom, it was a shared one. The upstairs seating area was old and tired. The paint work on the outside was falling off and the downstairs toilet was dirt, broken with no light.
reviews.title: Absolute great, sincere hospitality making it a superb stopover.

reviews.text: Overall, it is cheap, and it is good for food and information about visa runs and tourist sites, but the negatives outweigh the positives.
reviews.title: Much better elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (Was there in 2006 - scroll down doesn't let me put anyother date - altohugh passed by recently and from the outside it looks the same)
reviews.title: Cheap but Ok

reviews.text: Even though Ranong might lack the sights on itself, it'd deserve more credit once you explore it. Nonetheless is serves mainly as a port on to pha nga's coast all the way to Phuket. This coast has some beautiful gems that remain to be explored by the conventional tourist.
reviews.title: Good place for an overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you dont like cats, cat pee and poo this is not the place for you. Otherwise they are helpful with arranging visaruns to Burma. And they have a free WIFI if you have your own computer so you can find a better place to stay. They charge 300 baht for a room, with shared bathroom, worth no more than 100 Baht.
reviews.title: do not go here

reviews.text: As we travelled to Thailand overland we only had a 14 day visa on arrival so we had to do a visa run to last us another 14 days, we were recommended Kiwi Orchid Guesthouse from a hotel in Bangkok and we arrived from Bangkok in Ranong at 5am, greeted by the lovely Jai, and had finished our visa run to Myanmar by 10am and on the next bus to Krabi. Jai was so helpful and generous and very efficient!
reviews.title: Really helpful lady, great with visa runs!
